thread.title: Michigan State women's hoops wants to run with Aerial Powers, Morgan Green
thread.title_full: Michigan State women's hoops wants to run with Aerial Powers, Morgan Green

author: freep.com
title: Michigan State women's hoops wants to run with Aerial Powers, Morgan Green
text:
MORE
ROSEMONT, Ill. – Suzy Merchant has seen the triangle-and-two defense plenty over the years, because she watches a lot of high school basketball on the recruiting trail.
The Michigan State women's basketball coach had not seen the defense — which involves a three-player zone inside and two others playing man-to-man against the opposition's top two players — in college basketball, until she went through a season with a depleted roster and two stars.
"I've never been triangle-and-two'd in college until last year," Merchant said Thursday during Big Ten basketball media day. "I would welcome anybody to try that this year, because that's not gonna go very well (for them)."
Merchant and the Spartans sound ready to turn the tables on some people. And the way junior forward Aerial Powers (21.9 points per game last season) and junior guard Tori Jankoska (17.5) dragged the Spartans to a 16-15 finish last season resulted in some Thursday respect: MSU was picked third in the preseason Big Ten coaches poll, behind league favorite Maryland and Ohio State.
That's not what the Spartans are thinking.
"That's OK, we've just got to prove people wrong," said Powers, who earned All-America honors as a sophomore and should be ready for the season despite recent foot soreness. "I think we're gonna be way better than people think."
The Spartans are deep now, after getting down to seven players overall and five scholarship players last season. Senior center Jasmine Hines leads the talented supporting class for preseason All-Big Ten honorees Powers and Jankoska, and newcomers include 5-foot-8 point guard Morgan Green of San Jose, Calif.
Merchant called Green "super athletic" and "amazing" with the ball.
"She's really good," Powers said. "She's quick, she's quick defensively, too. And she can see the floor really, really well. So any mismatches, she'll already know and be able to break the defense down. She loves to pass."
Merchant said she's running three teams in practice for the first time in a long time and that, if the Spartans stay healthy, "we have a chance to do some things."
"We're gonna be able to run teams down," Powers said, "like they were doing us last year."
Contact Joe Rexrode: jrexrode@freepress.com. Follow him on Twitter @joerexrode . Check out his MSU blog at freep.com/heyjoe . Download our new Spartans Xtra app for free on Apple and Android devices!
